revised_title: A Report on a Surprising Shoal of Pumice-Stones Found Floating on the Sea
tldr: In 1725, John Dove reported a surprising discovery of a large shoal of pumice stones floating on the sea during a voyage to India. The pumice stones were found in the South Atlantic Ocean, thousands of miles away from any known land. Dove documented the location, size, and density of the pumice drifts, and speculated on their origin. This report is an important early observation of oceanic pumice distribution and its potential impact on navigation.
